params.creationCode: The creation code of a hook contract
params.deployer: The address that will deploy the hook. In `forge test`, this will be the test contract `address(this)` or the pranking address                 In `forge script`, this should be `0x4e59b44847b379578588920cA78FbF26c0B4956C` (CREATE2 Deployer Proxy)
params.salt: The salt used to deploy the hook

params.constructorArgs: The encoded constructor arguments of a hook contract. Example: `abi.encode(address(manager))`
params.creationCode: The creation code of a hook contract. Example: `type(Counter).creationCode`
params.deployer: The address that will deploy the hook. In `forge test`, this will be the test contract `address(this)` or the pranking address                 In `forge script`, this should be `0x4e59b44847b379578588920cA78FbF26c0B4956C` (CREATE2 Deployer Proxy)
params.flags: The desired flags for the hook address
params.seed: Use 0 for as a default. An optional starting salt when linearly searching for a salt. Useful for finding salts for multiple hooks with the same flags

returns._0: hookAddress salt and corresponding address that was found. The salt can be used in `new Hook{salt: salt}(<constructor arguments>)`

computeAddress(address,uint256,bytes).notice: Precompute a contract address deployed via CREATE2

find(address,uint160,uint256,bytes,bytes.notice: Find a salt that produces a hook address with the desired `flags`

documentation.text:
@title HookMiner - a library for mining hook addresses
 @dev This library is intended for `forge test` environments. There may be gotchas when using salts in `forge script` or `forge create`
